description.original: Simple timeline generator for story tellers
description.translation: Simple timeline generator for story tellers

dict.metadataKeyEventStartDate:\"The key that: metadataKeyEventStartDate:"The key that determines the start of an event in a note"
dict.metadataKeyEventEndDate:\"The key that d: metadataKeyEventEndDate:"The key that determines the end of an event in a note"
dict.metadataKeyEventTitleOverride:\"The key: metadataKeyEventTitleOverride:"The key for the title override in each notes metadata"
dict.metadataKeyEventBodyOverride:\"The key f: metadataKeyEventBodyOverride:"The key for the body override in each notes metadata"
dict.metadataKeyEventPictureOverride:\"The ke: metadataKeyEventPictureOverride:"The key for the image override in each notes metadata"
dict.metadataKeyEventTimelineTag:\"The key lo: metadataKeyEventTimelineTag:"The key looked for when assigning timelines to an event"
dict.markdownBlockTagsToFindSeparator:\"The c: markdownBlockTagsToFindSeparator:"The character or string used to split the different tags to find in a markdown code block. The split values will be looked for in notes."
dict.noteInlineEventKey:'Used to detect inlin: noteInlineEventKey:'Used to detect inline events. This is the key written after the "%%" signs to open an inline event block.'
dict.inlineEventEndOfBodyMarker:\"Used to mar: inlineEventEndOfBodyMarker:"Used to mark the line where the body parsing will stop"
dict.eventRenderToggleKey:\"The key used to c: eventRenderToggleKey:"The key used to control if a perculiar event is rendered or not"
dict.lookForInlineEventsInNotes:\"Look for ev: lookForInlineEventsInNotes:"Look for events in note body"
dict.lookForInlineEventsInNotes:\"Check to en: lookForInlineEventsInNotes:"Check to ennable the inline event feature. This allows to define events for any timeline from inside a note."
dict.lookForInlineEventsInNotes:\"Check {link: lookForInlineEventsInNotes:"Check {linkText} on how to create inline events."
dict.lookForTagsForTimeline:\"Check to includ: lookForTagsForTimeline:"Check to include a notes tags into the values used to assign notes to a timeline"
dict.lookForTagsForTimeline:\"This means if y: lookForTagsForTimeline:"This means if you tag you note with a string and include that string in the timeline definition this note will be included in the timeline computing"
dict.applyAdditonalConditionFormatting:\"Togg: applyAdditonalConditionFormatting:"Toggle on to allow date tokens conditional formatting to be allowed. When set to false this feature will be skipped. This could save you a few milliseconds off every card render."
dict.stylizeDateInline:\"Turn on to align the: stylizeDateInline:"Turn on to align the date with the title in the timeline cards."
dict.stylizeDateInline:\"Turn on for a more c: stylizeDateInline:"Turn on for a more compact display in your timeline event cards. Or turn off for more space."
dict.fantasyCalendarPresetKeys:\"This will pr: fantasyCalendarPresetKeys:"This will preset all relevant keys in the settings to watch fantasy calendar uses. Namely the title override, the start date and end date keys"
dict.fantasyCalendarSpanEvents:\"Allow the pl: fantasyCalendarSpanEvents:"Allow the plugin to look for span events inside the notes, this have a performance impact but furthers the compatibility with fantasy calendar"
dict.dateFontSize:\"Override the font size of: dateFontSize:"Override the font size of the date in the timeline cards (value in pixels)"
dict.titleFontSize:\"Override the font size o: titleFontSize:"Override the font size of the title in the timeline cards (value in pixels)"
dict.bodyFontSize:\"Override the font size of: bodyFontSize:"Override the font size of the body in the timeline cards (value in pixels)"
dict.dateFormatFlowOnboarding:\"For this plug: dateFormatFlowOnboarding:"For this plugin to work it needs to be fed a couple of informations regarding dates and how to sort them.Right now token priority is as follow {dateParserGroupPriority} and output is formated using {dateDisplayFormat}. To customize this you can either use the more user friendly flow by pressing start or just edit the values yourself by hand. Worst case scenario you can also reset to default in the advanced section."
dict.description:{normal:\"The most vanilla w: description:{normal:"The most vanilla way to display a date."
dict.imperial:\"The true american way of disp: imperial:"The true american way of displaying a date."
dict.verbose-day\":\"For when you enjoy addin: verbose-day":"For when you enjoy adding silly leters at the end of numbers. This format will append the st nd rd th particles after the days."
dict.\"dnd-calendar-of-harptos-dalereckoning\: "dnd-calendar-of-harptos-dalereckoning":`Good for D&D session notes - The Calendar of Harptos was the calendar used across most of Faer\xFBn. It was created by the wizard Harptos of Kaalinth, although most people associate the word "Harptos" with the calendar. It was split into twelve months, each lasting three tendays (or thirty days). There were an additional five days that fell between months, bringing the total number of days in most years to 365. - Dalereckoning is taken from the Year of Sunrise, 1 DR, when the Standing Stone was raised by the elves of Cormanthyr and the humans of the Dalelands. Since this time, humans were permitted by the Elven Court to settle in the more open regions of the forests. In some texts, primarily those which do not have direct ties to Dalesfolk history, Dalereckoning is called Freeman's Reckoning (FR). The calendar is widely used in Faer\xFBn but has not spread beyond its shores.`}
dict.dateParserRegex:\"The regex used to pars: dateParserRegex:"The regex used to parse your date. It needs to include the same amount of capture group as the next setting input. If you're unfamilliar with regexes and / or capture groups I would recommend to stick to the preset."
dict.dateParserGroupPriority:'No spaces and m: dateParserGroupPriority:'No spaces and make sure to separate every entry with a ",". This value is used to order the parsed tokens. For example if your custom regex pulls the year month and day out of a date, the natural order should be "year,month,day". Note that you should have as many entries as your regex has capture groups. See presets for inspiration.'
dict.dateDisplayFormat:\"This is the end form: dateDisplayFormat:"This is the end format the date should be displayed as in the actual timeline cards. You don't actually need to include every parsed member here."
dict.NUMBER:`A numerical typed date token is: NUMBER:`A numerical typed date token is your stardard number representing a date. Just make sure to configure it's mininal lengh. For example a minimal length set to 2 will result in the 6th day being written as "06"`
dict.minLength:\"The minimum amount of digits: minLength:"The minimum amount of digits",hideSign:"Hide the sign"
dict.minLength:\"If set to 2, this would alwa: minLength:"If set to 2, this would always display at least two digit. So for a value of 3 it would display 03."
dict.hideSign:\"When checked, the sign of the: hideSign:"When checked, the sign of the number won't be displayed on the card."
dict.conditionsAreExclusive:\"When checked on: conditionsAreExclusive:"When checked only one condition need to be true for the format to apply. If it's unchecked all conditions need to be true."
dict.format:\"Use `{value}` to include the fo: format:"Use `{value}` to include the formated token in the template."
dict.createDateToken:\"Write your date system: createDateToken:"Write your date system tokens ordered from top to bottom. Make sure not to leave any cluter, these token will be used to capture your date and sort them in the expeted order."
dict.tryoutDoesNotResolve:\"Optional: Tryout: tryoutDoesNotResolve:"Optional: Tryout does not resolve, try typing the date as you would in the metadata of a note"
dict.ignoreLineCommentToken:\"Use this token: ignoreLineCommentToken:"Use this token to remove lines of text in notes from the card"
dict.ignoreLineCommentToken:\"It should look: ignoreLineCommentToken:"It should look something like this `Your line of text in a note %%aat-ignore-line%%`"
dict.tryYourInputFormat:\"Just type out the d: tryYourInputFormat:"Just type out the date like you would in a notes metadata block. Bellow, every field should corespond to the correct token and be sorted in the correct order."
dict.tokenMismatchList:\"The previous list co: tokenMismatchList:"The previous list contains tokens that can't be found in your date token configuration, use the button bellow to update the token list and configure it properly once synced."
dict.syncTokens:\"Update tokens to reflect th: syncTokens:"Update tokens to reflect the above configuration"
dict.stringTokenDctionaryEntry:\"Type the des: stringTokenDctionaryEntry:"Type the desired output of the token..."
